column1: An Innovative Genetic Algorithm for the Quantum Circuit Compilation Problem

column2: Angelo Oddi@Istituto di Scienze e Tecnologie della Cognizione

column1: Quantum Computing represents the next big step towards speed boost in computation
column2: which promises major breakthroughs in several disciplines including Artificial Intelligence. This paper investigates the performance of a genetic algorithm to optimize the realization (compilation) of nearest-neighbor compliant quantum circuits. Currrent technological limitations (e.g.
column3: decoherence effect) impose that the overall duration (makespan) of the quantum circuit realization be minimized
column4: and therefore the makespanminimization problem of compiling quantum algorithms on present or future quantum machines is dragging increasing attention in the AI community. In our genetic algorithm
column5: a solution is built utilizing a novel chromosome encoding where each gene controls the iterative selection of a quantum gate to be inserted in the solution
column6: over a lexicographic double-key ranking returned by a heuristic function recently published in the literature.
